bill_title: allow certain persons to administer epinephrine in certain circumstances.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow certain persons to administer epinephrine in certain circumstances. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Any emergency medical services personnel may administer epinephrine to a person if the epinephrine is carried on the person and: (1) The person requests the administration; or (2) The person is having a known allergic event. Section 2. Any emergency medical services personnel acting in good faith and in compliance with the provisions of this Act is not be liable for any civil damages arising out of the administration of epinephrine. Section 3. For the purposes of this Act, emergency medical services personnel include emergency medical technicians, law enforcement officers, and firefighters. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
